question.text: Bacteria attacking the dead animals, represents:

options.text: First link of the food chain and are known as primary producers
Second link of the food chain and are herbivorous
Third link of the food chain and are tertiary consumers
The end of food chain and are decomposers

solution.text: Bacteria attacking the dead animals represent the end of the food chain and are decomposers. These are the organisms that obtain energy from chemical breakdown of organisms. They secrete enzymes to decompose dead matters and then absorb the broken down products. Bacteria are specialised to breakdown organic materials that are difficult for other organisms to digest. They also fulfil a vital role in the ecosystem, returning the constituents of organic matter to the environment in inorganic forms so that they can again be assimilated by producers.
